title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 7 ยง 723.2 - Description
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 7 ยง 723.2 - Description

State Regulations
(a) The department
operates a telephone system for inmates as one of the modes by which they may
maintain contact with family and friends at home. This system provides a
controlled list of up to 15 phone numbers accessible to each inmate which, at
most locations, can be self-dialed at telephones in housing units. Employee
assisted dialing is used for calls outside of the continental United States, Canada, U.S. Virgin Islands, Puerto Rico, Guam and Central Northern Marianna

Islands, and for emergency calls. (b) Facilities may, with the prior approval
of the Deputy Commissioner for Program Services, add additional restrictions in
order to meet certain unique facility needs. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 7
ยง
723.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
